intro: Spermacoce melochioides, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with slightly hairy surfaces, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, white seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
